isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (356 MM) AND 15 1/2-INCH (394 MM) TWO-PLATE, PULL-TYPE CLUTCH - REMOVE - CLUTCH

step1.para: Prior to actual clutch removal, install a clutch disc aligning tool to the driven disc and release bearing assembly ( Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Install Clutch Disc Aligning Tool

note.para: Two 5/8-inch (15.9 mm) wooden blocks must be inserted ( Figure 16) between the clutch release bearing housing and the clutch flywheel ring before removing the clutch mounting bolts.

You must progressively loosen the mounting bolts in a criss-cross pattern to prevent cocking and bending within the clutch and assure easy removal of the clutch-mounting bolts. The wooden spacers relieve the heavy internal spring load in the clutch assembly.

Because of the heavy weight of a 15 1/2" (394 mm) clutch ( Figure 17), install two guide studs in the top-mounting bolt holes to ease removal. Now remove the mounting bolts and carefully remove the clutch assembly.

step1.para: When all the bolts have been removed, slide the clutch assembly back and off. Use caution to keep the alignment tool in place to retain the discs and intermediate plate.
Carefully remove aligning tool, rear disc, intermediate plate and front disc.
